customer_name: The Wyman Living History Ranch & Museum
site_name: The Wyman Living History Ranch & Museum

citations.narrative:
3.131.(c) Housekeeping
Near the gate, the woven wire had 3 broken strands where the elk had pushed his muzzle into the spaces. The pass-
through door from the hay storage to the shelter had 3 screw end protruding into the shelter side of the door. The ends of
the broken strands and screw points are sharp and the could injure the elk. The sharp points must be repaired, replaced
or removed. Premises (buildings and grounds) shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the animals from
injury.
Inspection and exit interview was done with a facility representative.
This is the 1st Re-License inspection for a Class “C” license. All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s)
or by July 29, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply.
Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n
